intro: Singchia malipoensis, commonly known as the Malipo sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous areas. Singchia malipoensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
